title: Venezuela despliega tropas en ejercicios militares por "amenaza" de buque britÃ¡nico en Guyana - Meganoticias
text: Venezuela despliega tropas en ejercicios militares por "amenaza" de buque britÃ¡nico en Guyana Â¿QuÃ© pasÃ³? MÃ¡s de 5.600 efectivos participaron este jueves en ejercicios militares ordenados por el presidente de Venezuela, NicolÃ¡s Maduro, en respuesta a la llegada de un buque de guerra britÃ¡nico a Guyana, que negÃ³ tener planes para una "acciÃ³n ofensiva" contra su vecino. La llegada del HMS Trent rompe una frÃ¡gil tregua entre ambos paÃ­ses dentro de una centenaria pugna por el territorio del Esequibo, rico en petrÃ³leo, que se avivÃ³ en los Ãºltimos meses. [Ir a la siguiente nota](https://www.meganoticias.cl/mundo/435126-asteroide-dios-del-caos-99942-cuando-pasara-cerca-de-la-tierra-apofis-fecha-pdp-28-12-2023.html) El arribo de la nave de la Armada BritÃ¡nica asoma como una muestra de apoyo diplomÃ¡tico y militar a Guyana, considerando que la naciÃ³n era una colonia y es la Ãºnica del continente que sigue siendo parte de la Mancomunidad. Â¿QuÃ© dijeron desde Venezuela por el despliegue militar? En una cadena de radio y televisiÃ³n, y acompaÃ±ado del alto mando militar, Maduro seÃ±alÃ³ que "he ordenado la activaciÃ³n de una acciÃ³n conjunta de toda la Fuerza Armada Nacional Bolivariana sobre el Caribe Oriental de Venezuela, sobre la Fachada AtlÃ¡ntica". El mandatario seÃ±alÃ³ que se trata de "una acciÃ³n conjunta de carÃ¡cter defensiva y como respuesta a la provocaciÃ³n y a la amenaza del Reino Unido contra la paz y la soberanÃ­a de nuestro paÃ­s". Â¿QuÃ© dijeron desde Guyana? En tanto, desde Guyana negaron que la llegada del HSM Trent responda a "planes" para un ataque. Estas son "asociaciones" destinadas a "mejorar la seguridad interna" y "no representan una amenaza para nadie y de ninguna manera pretenden ser agresivas o constituir un acto ofensivo", dijo el presidente guyanÃ©s, Irfaan Ali, en Facebook. "Ni Venezuela ni ningÃºn otro Estado tiene nada que temer de las actividades dentro del territorio o aguas soberanas de Guyana", aÃ±adiÃ³ Ali que enviÃ³ sus "mejores deseos" a Venezuela. MÃ¡s temprano, el vicepresidente guyanÃ©s, Barrat Jagdeo, seÃ±alÃ³ que Guyana no tenÃ­a planeado "invadir Venezuela". "El presidente Maduro lo sabe", dijo Jagdeo, quien descartÃ³ cancelar "la actitivad programada" con los britÃ¡nicos. Una fuente del ministerio de Exteriores de Guyana dijo a la AFP mÃ¡s temprano que el buque arribarÃ¡ a las costas de ese paÃ­s el viernes, donde permanecerÃ¡ por "menos de una semana" para ejercicios de defensa en mar abierto. author: Written
title: Energize Us Edu Inc.: Empowering Students from Classroom to Professional Success
text:
In the heart of Americaâ€™s educational landscape, a revolution is underway, spearheaded by Energize Us Edu Inc. This visionary institution, under the stewardship of founder Wilson Matthew Betances, is not just a trade school â€“ itâ€™s a movement, a commitment to reshaping the future of workforce development from classroom to career.
Energize Us Edu Inc. doesnâ€™t settle for ordinary; it aspires to be the â€˜Ivy Leagueâ€™ of trade schools, a testament to the pursuit of excellence in trade education. From high school students exploring their first sparks of interest to seasoned professionals seeking continuous improvement, Energize Us Edu Inc. is committed to fostering a passion for trades at every level.
The institutionâ€™s ambitious vision transcends the traditional boundaries of education. By 2025, Energize Us Edu Inc. plans to establish chapters on both the East and West Coasts, creating a national network that seamlessly integrates education and employment. The goal is not just to provide top-tier training but to connect graduates with opportunities within the institutionâ€™s expansive contractor network, where the value placed on quality training and mindset culture is reciprocated with fair compensation.
Beyond training and employment, Energize Us Edu Inc. sets its sights on addressing the practical challenges faced by aspiring professionals. By 2026, the institution aims to provide affordable housing for its network contractors and students. Recognizing the financial constraints of entry-level positions and rising interest rates, Energize Us Edu Inc. stands firm in its commitment to selling opportunities, not just courses. For those sponsored by network contractors, affordable housing throughout their studies becomes a tangible reality, ensuring that financial constraints do not hinder personal and professional growth.
http://linkedin.com/in/energizeus stands out as more than an educational institution; it is a catalyst for reshaping the future of workforce development. The programâ€™s curriculum is accredited throughout the USA by the Department of Labor and Education, meeting pre-apprenticeship standards.
As the company grows, it is poised to go wherever its students and network take it, reaffirming its commitment to providing opportunities for growth and success. Energize Us Edu Inc. isnâ€™t selling courses; itâ€™s selling life-changing opportunities, embodying a vision where success begins in the classroom and extends to every corner of professional life.

author: Vicky Arias
title: Rick Warren Under Fire for Tweet about Crucifixion
text:
Guest Commentary Rick Warren Under Fire for Tweet about Crucifixion Rick Warren, former pastor of Saddleback Church, faced backlash after tweeting that Jesus' position between two thieves symbolized a centrist... Vicky Arias Updated Feb 17, 2025
Former pastor of Saddleback Church in California, Rick Warren, is receiving backlash after posting a tweet that many viewed as an improper application of the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ. Warren's tweet on Feb. 11 likened Jesus' central position between two thieves during His Crucifixion to Him landing somewhere in the center of today's political landscape rather than on one side or the other.
"If you're looking for the #realJesus, not a caricature disfigured by partisan motivations, you'll find him in the middle, not on either side," Warren stated.
The evangelist deleted the tweet within a few days, but not before it had more than three million views. Ah, man. And @RickWarren never bothered responding to me either ðŸ˜” ðŸ¤£ pic.twitter.com/EQEn6Fxnar
â€” Gabriel Padilla (@gdilla_) February 14, 2025 The statement prompted many conservative Christians to criticize Warren's theology.
Allie Beth Stuckey, a conservative podcaster and author, denounced the tweet as "lukewarm," noting that Jesus has and teaches very definitive stances.
"This is possibly the worst Biblical interpretation I've ever seen, and that's really saying something," Stuckey stated. "Jesus is not 'in the middle' on the murder of children, gender deception, the definition of marriage , or anything else, for that matter. In fact, I seem to remember Him having a particular disdain for the lukewarm." With Jesus, itâ€™s not the things he said that people might not understand, but itâ€™s usually the things they understand that cause them angst. Read the Bible for yourself, see what Jesus really did and said, donâ€™t just accept the word of certain teachers. Scripture sides with Allieâ€¦ https://t.co/jiYIE6xwmv
â€” Terry Unrein (@StorageBytes) February 12, 2025 Daily Wire host Michael Knowles pointed to the seriousness of the decisions made by each of the thieves who were hung next to Jesus.
"Except that the thief to Our Lord's right is in Heaven, and the thief to His left is in Hell ," Knowles declared. "Not the best analogy for the point you wish to make."
The CEO of the Babylon Bee, Seth Dillon, also chimed in, explaining with a bit of sarcasm that Jesus stood His ground and never compromised the truth.
"Yeah, because if there's one thing Jesus was known for, it was his desire to meet in the middle and compromise on the issues that matter most," Dillon asserted.
Saddleback Church, founded by Warren in 1980, was removed from the Southern Baptist Convention (SBC) denomination in 2023 after allowing a woman to hold the title of teaching pastor.
After Warren retired in 2022, Stacie Wood, the wife of the new lead pastor of Saddleback, Pastor Andy Wood, was named pastor of the church, defying SBC's stance on women being disallowed in the capacity of pastor.
Warren gave a statement at a 2023 SBC meeting, asking for the church not to be removed, though the church's removal did , in fact, come to pass.
"We should remove churches for all kinds of sexual sins, racial sin, financial sin, leadership sin, sins that harm the testimony of our convention," Warren stated. "But the 1,129 churches with women on pastoral staff have not sinned."
Jenna Ellis, podcast host and attorney , tweeted that Jesus wasn't a "moderate."
"Jesus is not a moderate or 'in the middle' when it comes to truth," Ellis stated. "To characterize him as such simply because of the placement of his cross is perverting a historical fact into a symbolic meaning to serve your own ideological agenda."
On Sunday, Warren tweeted an apology.
"I apologize," Warren stated. "I wrote poorly. I don't believe Jesus was a centrist. He stands far above it all. 'My kingdom is not of this world...' Jn. 18:36 Jesus demands our total allegiance as the center of our lives." I apologize. I wrote poorly.
I don't believe Jesus was a centrist. He stands far above it all. â€œMy kingdom is not of this world..." Jn.18:36
Jesus demands our total allegiance as the center of our lives.
â€” Rick Warren (@RickWarren) February 16, 2025 Photo Credit: Â©RNS/Adelle M. Banks
Vicky Arias is passionate about using any gifts God has given her to bring glory to Jesus and raise awareness about people who are suffering from poverty, exploitation, persecution, and the loneliness of enduring hardship under the radar. She has worked with International Justice Mission â€“ a global Christian organization that aids survivors of human trafficking; International Christian Concern â€“ a Christian persecution watchdog; FISM News â€“ a Christian news outlet, and others. Vicky has written news articles on topics including human trafficking, Supreme Court rulings, politics, Christian persecution, the economy, social issues, and much more. She loves to learn and earned her bachelorâ€™s degree in English Literature and Creative Writing from DePaul University. When sheâ€™s not tackling the current news cycle or interviewing someone for a story, you can probably find her writing poetry, taking pictures, or spending time with her husband. Vicky loves music, concerts, and all things Paris. You can find more of Vickyâ€™s articles, scholarly papers, and even some of her poetic reflections at https://vlarias7.journoportfolio.com/
Originally published February 17, 2025. SHARE
